meanings.definition: A large long-handled spoon with a cup-shaped bowl, used for serving soup, stew, or sauce.
meanings.sent1: The cook used ladles to serve the delicious soup.
meanings.sent2: Mom always uses ladles to scoop out the stew.
meanings.sent3: The ladles clinked together as they were placed back in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The ladles danced in the steamy kitchen, ready to serve.
meanings.sent5: The shiny ladles gleamed under the bright kitchen lights.

meanings.definition: To serve (a liquid or food) with a ladle.
meanings.sent1: She ladles the hot soup into bowls for the guests.
meanings.sent2: Dad ladles the gravy onto the mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent3: He ladles the sauce with a flourish, like a chef in a fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The rain ladles down from the dark clouds, soaking everything.
meanings.sent5: She ladles out kindness to everyone she meets.

meanings.definition: To lift out or serve with a ladle.
meanings.sent1: He ladles out the pasta from the pot onto the plates.
meanings.sent2: The bartender ladles out drinks to the thirsty customers.
meanings.sent3: She ladles out compliments as easily as pouring water.
meanings.sent4: The moon ladles out moonlight, bathing the earth in its glow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ladles out knowledge to eager students.
